result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent. Credit for 93 days served.
Probation to be with the mental health unit.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a course in anger management.
Complete parenting classes.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
DV assessment imposed as to count 4.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Random drug screens.
No contact with E.A. Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all nonwaivable costs, assessments and surcharges including  the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

miscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant of appellant rights.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: STAYED: to be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Carmelo Arroyo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Joel Carmelo Arroyo.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing held. Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 93 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR.

AS TO COUNT 6: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 93 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARs.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 30 days condition time, STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent, as to count 6
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Random drug screens.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Probation to be with the mental health unit.
- Vocational and educational training.
- Complete 30 hours of community service.
- No contact with E.A.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.  
- Provide a DNA sample.
- DV assessment imposed, as to count 4.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Joel Carmelo Arroyo.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 3.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 5.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 4 AND 6.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Court VACATED jury trial. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Filed: Jury Instructions, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.

CASE CALLED FOR BRANCH 41

Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Joel Carmelo Arroyo.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. Defendant has another case 22CF1165. State filed motion to join; Court GRANTED state's motion for joinder. Jury trial remains calendared for October 3, 2022 at 8:30 am. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial/ jury status hearing in Branch 36. Final pre-trial/ Jury status hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion to Join
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. EXPIRES 11/21/2022
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  EXPIRES 11/21

Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Joel Carmelo Arroyo.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel enters speedy trial request and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 6 person scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear by video.  Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Staszewski. Court took judicial notice of 22CF1165. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $15,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Elizabeth A or Aliannah S A.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel Carmelo Arroyo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
